decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The advertisement panels, by virtue of their size and prominence would be inappropriate and unacceptable in the context of surrounding development and thus harmful to the street scene and local visual amenity, specifically with reference to the effect on the outlook of neighbouring residents to the west, contrary to adopted Unitary Development Plan to Policies ENV B.1.1 (New Development) and ENV B.1.4 (Advertisements) and the guidance set out in the relevant national: Planning Policy Guidance relating to advertisements.

Condition : 2 - The advertisements, incorporating three large illuminated displays represents a potential distraction to motorists, at a point where conditions necessitate drivers' full attention, and would thus be harmful to the safety and free flow of traffic on the adjoining elevated M4 trunk road and the A4 Great West Road which are busy, heavily-trafficked through routes, to adopted Unitary Development Plan Policies ENV B.1.1 (New Development), ENV B.1.4 (Advertisements) and T.4.4 (Traffic Safety) of the adopted Unitary Development Plan and the guidance set out in the relevant national: Planning Policy Guidance relating to advertisements.
description: Erection of advertisment display on existing building
